author: tjayrush
content: I was one of the three people mentioned above who wrote a script to calculate the value four or five weeks ago -- a "user" in that sense. (https://github.com/Great-Hill-Corporation/trueblocks-core/blob/develop/src/other/issuance/README.md)

author: tjayrush
content: I have an idea that would require almost no work, have no effect on consensus, and not increase the size of the data on disc.

author: tjayrush
content: One could make the job of the "script writer" way easier by adding an RPC command called `eth_issuance` or `eth_supply` (or both) which would report how many new Ether were created (and/or destroyed) during that block.

author: tjayrush
content: It could take options such as `issuance` vs. `supply_change`. Issuance would be how many new ether came into existance ignoring burns (such as `self-destruct-to-self`). Supply change would take those things into account.

author: tjayrush
content: The script could be a one liner: `forEveryBlock bn { total_issuance += eth_issuance(bn) }`

author: tjayrush
content: No change to consensus. No change to data on disc. Makes the number much easier to produce. Simple addition to RPC that effects only a single block at a time making it highly parallelizable.
